title: Energy Economics
overview: Energy Economics is an important course with high practical relevance for economics students, particularly those in the field of natural resource economics, in the context of global energy security and climate change.

key_concepts: Economic and Technical Calculations for Energy Projects

skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be equipped with methods and skills to analyze and draft energy policies.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Building and Analyzing Energy Investment Projects
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be equipped with methods and skills to build and analyze energy investment projects.
Students will develop the ability to self-study and research to complete assigned tasks.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Drawing Conclusions on Energy Economics, Energy Policy, and Energy Investment Projects
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to draw conclusions on issues related to energy economics, energy policy, and energy investment projects.
